title: Zelensky leaves White House after heated exchange with Trump
summary: US President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance scolded Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Friday in a tense Oval Office exchange, telling him to be more 'thankful' and warning, 'make a deal with Russia or we're out.' Zelensky left in his motorcade shortly after, without holding a planned joint press conference.

title: Zelensky, after White House fallout, says it's 'difficult' for Ukraine to hold off Russia without US
summary: The Ukrainian President interviewed with Fox News's Brett Baier after the White House talks with President Donald Trump went south earlier Friday.

title: War in Ukraine: 'For the Russians, it's a dream come true: An American president repeats their propaganda'
summary: Liubov Tsybulska, a Ukrainian specialist in Russian disinformation, described to Le Monde the 'enormous shock' felt by Ukrainians when they heard Donald Trump use the same rhetoric as the Russians.

title: The Le Scouarnecs, a family haunted by sexual violence: 'I was taught to keep quiet'
summary: The former surgeon Joël Le Scouarnec is on trial in France for the rapes and assaults of 299 children. In the courthouse, witnesses painted a picture of a family haunted by sexual violence.

title: Pope suffers coughing fit setback that now requires assisted ventilation, Vatican says
summary: Pope Francis has lung disease and was admitted into care in Rome at Gemelli hospital on February 14 after a bout of bronchitis worsened and turned into pneumonia in both lungs.

title: 2025 César awards put independent French filmmaking in the spotlight
summary: The 50th edition of the prestigious film awards, held on Friday night, is shining a spotlight on French feature films that have proven successful in theaters.

title: Gene Hackman had likely been dead nine days when found, sheriff says
summary: The bodies of the Oscar-winning star of 'The French Connection' and his wife were found on Wednesday, after emergency services were called to the scene when maintenance workers had been unable to access the couple's property in Santa Fe, New Mexico.

title: François Hollande: 'Donald Trump is no longer our ally'
summary: France's former president says that Trump's new term marks 'a profound break' in international relations, particularly with Europe.

title: Macron says EU will impose reciprocal tariffs on US steel and aluminium
summary: The French president insisted that 'Europeans will have to respond' to his American counterpart's threat to hit the European Union with 25% tariffs.

title: Trump and the temptation of manipulating the dollar
summary: Stephen Miran, the incoming head of the White House Council for Economic Analysis, has proposed a controversial strategy: forcing foreign dollar holders to invest in US Treasury bonds to finance the US economy.

title: Microsoft announces Skype is shutting down
summary: 'Starting in May 2025, Skype will no longer be available,' Skype support announced on X, urging users to switch to Microsoft Teams.

title: 'The absurdity of Trump's obsessions can be illustrated with eggs'
summary: An unending avian flu epidemic has more than doubled prices in the space of a year, forcing the US government to import and financially support the sector, against its dogmas of closed borders and deregulation, points out Philippe Escande in his column.

title: Donald Trump's new 'star wars'
summary: On January 27, the US president signed an executive order announcing the creation of an anti-missile shield with the deployment of 'interceptors' in space. Their function is intended to be defensive, but this project marks a shift in the risks of 'weaponizing' space.

title: In Vermont, an ultralocal social network is as popular as Facebook
summary: In this rural and highly progressive state in the northeastern United States, a local social media platform called Front Porch Forum has managed to rival Facebook and Instagram. It's a low-tech, algorithm-free, neighborhood-centered alternative.

title: Nations agree to hard-fought nature funding plan at UN talks
summary: The decision comes more than two years after a landmark deal to halt the rampant destruction of nature this decade and protect the ecosystems and wildlife that humans rely on for food, climate regulation, and economic prosperity.

title: Over 200 defective Paris Olympics and Paralympics medals to be replaced
summary: Athletes have complained that their medals have become tarnished or chipped, sometimes within weeks of the Games ending last year.

title: Cyclone Garance in La Réunion island kills three people
summary: Winds of up to 230 kilometers per hour battered the French Indian Ocean territory of 900,000 people. The storm earlier forced the closure of the main airport on nearby Mauritius.

title: Israeli army's investigation into October 7 pinpoints failings in analysis of threat posed by Hamas
summary: The military leadership acknowledges that it was locked into a misperception of the Palestinian Islamist movement, seeing it as a group focused on managing the Gaza Strip, a secondary risk contained by the electronic fence.

title: Romania denies any US 'pressure' after departure of misogynist influencer Andrew Tate
summary: Andrew Tate and his brother Tristan, suspected of human trafficking and rape, were under a travel ban but were supported by the Trump administration.

title: 'Europe refuses to see that Vladimir Putin is in fact waging a war against it and against the West'
summary: In response to the totalitarian pressure exerted on Europe by the Russian president, Karl Schlögel, winner of the 2024 Jacques Delors European Book Prize, reminds us in an op-ed for Le Monde, of the European identity of Ukraine, and sounds the alarm about a return of the 'kidnapped West' evoked by Milan Kundera.

title: European leaders bet on Friedrich Merz
summary: The victory of the Christian Democratic leader in the February 23 German parliamentary elections was met with relief by France, Poland and other members that support a bolder role for the European Union in tackling security and economic challenges.

title: How France's far right became a mouthpiece for the wine lobby
summary: The election of far-right MPs in traditional winegrowing regions has prompted the party to start championing the wine sector – which isn't necessarily pleased.

title: Japan battles biggest wildfire in decades
summary: Flames are estimated to have spread over about 1,200 hectares (3,000 acres) in the forest of Ofunato in the northern region of Iwate since fire broke out on Wednesday. Over 1,000 nearby residents have been evacuated and more than 80 buildings had been damaged as of Friday, according to the Ofunato municipality.

title: Turkey's pro-Kurd party urges 'democratic solution' to insurgency
summary: The PKK, designated a terrorist group by Turkey, the United States and the European Union, has waged an insurgency since 1984 with the aim of carving out a homeland for Kurds, who account for around 20% of Turkey's 85 million people.

title: At the Opéra de Lausanne, Lauranne Oliva takes on the role of Mozart's rare 'Mitridate'
summary: In a precise, uncluttered staging by Emmanuelle Bastet, the 14-year-old Salzburger's first opera seria will be revived from April 2 to 8 at the Opéra Orchestre National Montpellier Occitanie.

title: European leaders rally behind Ukraine after Trump-Zelensky White House clash
summary: After a furious exchange between Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelensky in the White House on Friday, European leaders threw their support behind the Ukrainian president.

title: Ukraine's fate more precarious than ever after dramatic Trump-Zelensky clash
summary: What was supposed to be a traditional meeting in front of the cameras in the Oval Office, before the signing of a bilateral mineral agreement, turned into a fiery exchange on Friday, calling into question American support for Kyiv.

title: PKK declares ceasefire with Turkey after 40 years of armed struggle
summary: Abdullah Ocalan called last Thursday for his Kurdish militant group to lay down its weapons and dissolve itself in a landmark declaration read out in Istanbul.

title: Ukraine and Europe, alone against Russia
summary: The violent exchange between Donald Trump, JD Vance and Volodymyr Zelensky at the White House on Friday, February 28, illustrates the hostility of the Trump administration toward Ukraine and signals a breaking point in the relationship between the allies.

title: 'Emilia Pérez' wins big at Césars, Julia Roberts receives honorary award
summary: 'Emilia Perez' won big at France's equivalent of the Oscars on Friday evening, taking home seven awards, including best French film of the year.

title: Trump-Zelensky row, seen from Russia: Pro-Putin media amused by Trump's scolding of 'clown' Zelensky
summary: Former president Dmitry Medvedev set the tone for Russian reactions, both scornful and triumphant, after the heated exchanges at the White House between Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: France's largest child sexual abuse trial: What is Joël Le Scouarnec accused of?
summary: The trial of Le Scouarnec, a former surgeon accused of raping and sexually abusing almost 300 underage patients, began on Monday, February 24, and will last four months.

title: Europe, shocked by explosive Trump-Zelensky White House row, prepares for a decisive summit
summary: Emmanuel Macron, Donald Tusk, Olaf Scholz, Keir Starmer and Ursula von der Leyen immediately threw their support behind the Ukrainian president. They will meet on Sunday, March 2, in London for a summit on Ukraine organized by Starmer.

title: Zelensky says Trump's support still 'crucial' as Ukrainian leader arrives in UK for talks with PM
summary: The Ukrainian president released a lengthy statement following his showdown with Donald Trump and JD Vance at the White House on Friday.

title: S&P gives France an early warning
summary: The rating agency maintained France's AA- rating, but gave it a negative outlook, suggesting that it could be lowered in the coming months.

title: Cyclone Garance wreaks havoc on La Réunion island
summary: The cyclone, which crossed the island from north to south between Friday and Saturday, killed at least four people. It also caused extensive damage, notably due to very heavy rainfall.

title: Ukrainians angry, in shock after heated Trump-Zelensky White House meeting
summary: Ukrainians backed their President Zelensky after the disastrous exchange, but the country's opposition could take advantage of his failed trip to Washington.

title: Duplantis breaks his own pole vault world record with leap of 6.27m
summary: It was the 11th time Sweden's Armand Duplantis had broken the record by one centimeter since first claiming it with a leap of 6.16m in February 2020.
